Pandemics Research using Mass Spectrometry

Below are video tutorials for this GTN material, created for various (past) events.

Lecture & Demo Video (February 2021)

Description:

The Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) global pandemic has had a profound, lasting impact on the world’s population. Accurate and timely diagnosis of COVID-19 infection is an important step for providing care and containing its further spread. In this tutorial, attendees will be introduced to two workflows – a) database search workflow and b) peptide validation workflow. Attendees of the workshop will get an in-depth knowledge of the Galaxy workflows that detect SARS-CoV-2 peptides (10.1186/s12014-021-09321-1)) and co-infecting pathogen peptides (10.1021/acs.jproteome.0c00822).
Length: 35 minutes
Captions: Emma Leith
Created: 15 February 2021
Materials:
  • Slides
  • Workflow
Support:

How to Embed this

If your content supports iframes, you can copy this code:

<iframe src="https://gallantries.github.io/video-library/videos/proteomics/pandemic/external/embed.html" width="600" height="800" allow="encrypted-media *; fullscreen *; autoplay *;">

Or if you just want the URL to embed the content

https://gallantries.github.io/video-library/videos/proteomics/pandemic/external/embed.html
